titleStmt.title: Caines bloudy race known by their fruits, or, A true declaration of the innocent sufferings of the servants of the living God, by the magistrates, priests and people in the city of Westchester, who lives in a profession of God, Christ, and the Scriptures, as their forefathers did, who slew the prophets, persecuted Christ and the apostles, as is declared in the scriptures of truth, &c.
titleStmt.author: Hutchins, Anthony.

titleStmt.title: Caines bloudy race known by their fruits, or, A true declaration of the innocent sufferings of the servants of the living God, by the magistrates, priests and people in the city of Westchester, who lives in a profession of God, Christ, and the Scriptures, as their forefathers did, who slew the prophets, persecuted Christ and the apostles, as is declared in the scriptures of truth, &c.
titleStmt.author: Hutchins, Anthony.
Howgill, Francis, 1618-1669.
Sale, Richard.
Fox, George, 1624-1691.

notesStmt.note: Preface signed: F.H. [i.e. Francis Howgill]; pp. 21-22 are by Richard Sale and pp. 42-44 by George Fox.
Reproduction of original in Bodleian Library.
